intro: Rostellularia gracilis, commonly known as the slender rostellularia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy surface. Rostellularia gracilis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as undergrowth in forests or along stream banks.
